name: Kimball & Thompson Produce Company
notes: Major produce distributor with 22,055 sq ft warehouse in Lowell. Additional facilities in Oklahoma City (9,000 sq ft) and North Little Rock (10,000 sq ft). Operates Monday-Friday 7am-4pm CST. Holds $165 million military and school supply contracts. Five-generation family business.

name: Matthews Ridgeview Farms
notes: Largest grower/packer/shipper of sweet potatoes in Arkansas. State-of-the-art automated packing facility with electronic sizing line. Warehouse facility employs 80+ workers. Cold storage for entire crop. Sells over 1 million bushels annually to major retailers. Year-round supply for retail and wholesale. Seasonal shipping starts mid-to-late September. Family-owned with 100+ years history, operating since 2006 as Matthews Ridgeview Farms.

name: Proffer Wholesale Produce
notes: Operating 50+ years with farm and cold storage facility in Crossett. Full-service packinghouse in Park Hills, Missouri for custom packaging. Harvest season May-October. Seven-day availability. Sales representatives available 7am-5pm. Email: tiffany@profferproduce.com

name: Barnhill Orchards
notes: Family-owned sustainable farm established in 1980 by retired Air Force Lt. Col. Bob Barnhill. Hand-picked and hand-sorted produce for quality assurance. Strawberries available April, followed by blackberries, blueberries, peaches, then watermelons and cantaloupes in summer. On-farm sales Thursday-Sunday 9am-5:30pm. Email: barnhillorchards@aol.com

name: Arkansas Natural Produce
notes: Year-round greenhouse facility specializing in salad greens with seasonal vegetables. In business since 1988. Delivers to Little Rock and Hot Springs markets year-round. Over 50,000 sq ft of heated greenhouse space. Owners: Jay and Deanna Fulbright.

name: Peebles Organic Farms LLC
notes: 800-acre organic vegetable farm. USDA Organic certified. Retail and wholesale operations. Season: July-November. Processes pumpkins and produces certified organic edamame and green beans. Also operates Peebles Farm with corn maze and U-pick attractions.

name: Liberty Fruit Company
region: Midwest distribution (AR, IL, IA, KS, MO, NE, OK, SD)
notes: Founded 1965. Acquired by Russ Davis Wholesale. 350+ dedicated employees. Hand-selects premium fruits and vegetables with custom repacking to specifications. Offers bagging, overwraps, labeling, fresh daily. SQF Level 3 Version 7.2 Certified, HAACP Compliant, Kosher. Next-day delivery. Serves wholesale, retail, and foodservice customers across seven states.

name: Muzzarelli Farms (Arkansas Operations)
notes: New Jersey-based producer with wholesale operations serving Arkansas. Growing, packing, shipping and wholesale distribution. Currently accepting bulk orders for 2025 growing season. Email: cmuzzarelli1037@gmail.com. Alternative phone: (856) 207-1037
